Taste the gravy and adjust salt if needed. This is how to make the best chicken curry for Kottu Roti.', 'Cut the parotta into tiny pieces.', 'Slice the carrot, banana pepper, and leek. Also, chop the onion, green chili, and curry leaves.', 'Add a little salt to the eggs and whisk them for 2 or 3 minutes.', 'Now heat the oil in a large cooking wok and add the beaten eggs. Fry and scramble the eggs. For me, it takes about 5 minutes under medium flame. Once done, take off the scrambled eggs and keep them aside for final preparation.', 'Now, add some more oil to the same large cooking wok. Add carrot, banana pepper, half of the chopped onions, green chilies, and curry leaves.', 'Sauté those until carrots turn tender. Stir occasionally to avoid burning. For me, it takes about 5 minutes under high flame.', 'Then add the leeks and sauté them under medium flame for 2 minutes.', 'Now add parotta and chicken curry. Stir and mix frequently under medium flame for about 2 or 3 minutes. Taste and adjust salt if needed.', 'Finally, add fried scrambled eggs and the rest of the chopped onion. Switch off the flame and mix everything well until totally combined.', 'This is how to make the best chicken kottu rotti recipe at home. Serve and enjoy this Sri Lankan chicken kothu parotta dish with your friends and family.']

name: Sri Lankan Style Fish Patties Recipe with Potatoes(Deep Fry)
ingredients: ['-----For The Dough-----', 'All purpose flour - 500g', 'Butter - 100g', 'Salt - As you need', 'Cold water - 250ml', '-----For The Curry-----', 'Canned salmon fish - 350g(Fish only)', 'Potatoes - 350g', 'Onion - 200g', 'Green chili - 5 or 6', 'Garlic cloves - 4 or 5', 'Curry leaves - Few', 'Lime - 1', 'Water - 100ml', 'Mustard seeds - ½ teaspoon', 'Turmeric powder - ¼ teaspoon', 'Chili powder - 1 tablespoon', 'Cooking oil - As you need', 'Salt - As you need', '-----For Make and Fry the Patties-----', 'Floured surface with the roller', 'Patties cutter', 'All-purpose flour - 50g', 'Cooking oil - As you need']
instructions: ['Take a bowl and add all-purpose flour, butter, salt, and cold water.', 'Add the cold water little by little and knead the dough. Knead the dough for at least 10 minutes. The dough should be smooth and elastic but not sticky. Keep the dough aside for at least 1 hour before making the patties.', 'Chop the onions and potatoes.', 'Also, chop the curry leaves, green chilies, and garlic. Get ready with lime, chili powder, mustard seeds, turmeric powder, and salt.', 'Open the can and take out all the fish chunks.', 'Heat the oil and add mustard seeds, let it splutter. Then add the onion and fry them until soft and translucent. Now add curry leaves, green chilies, and garlic. Stir and fry them for 2 minutes under medium flame.', 'Add potatoes and fry them for another 2 minutes under low flame. Stir occasionally to avoid burning.', 'Now add the fish chunks, turmeric powder, chili powder, salt, and water.', 'Mash the fish chunks a little and mix everything well. Cook covered under medium flame for 3 minutes.', 'Now take off the lid and mash everything again. Cook uncovered under the low flame until all the water disappears. For me, it takes about 2 minutes. Finally, switch off the flame and add the lime juice. Give one last good mix.', 'Get ready with all the things you need to make the patties.', 'Take the floured surface with roller and patties cutter. Dust everything with the all-purpose flour. Now take a small ball from the dough and roll out that in the floured surface to a thin layer.', 'Now put that thin layer on top of the patties cutter. Fill the curry using a spoon.', 'At last, close and tighten the patties cutter. Take out the excess part of that thin layer and then open it.', 'Do the same to as many patties as you want until the curry finish.', 'Heat the oil in a deep fry wok and place the patties carefully. Fry them under medium flame until they turn to light brown.', 'This is how to make the best and tasty Sri Lankan style fish patties recipe. Serve and enjoy this delicious snack with your family or friends.']

name: Spicy Tinned Fish Sandwich Toast Recipe with Potato Masala
ingredients: ['Tinned fish - 285g (Only Fish Chunks)', 'Bread - 20 slices', 'Butter - As you wish', 'Potato - 500g', 'Onion - 200g', 'Garlic cloves - 5 or 6', 'Dried red chili - 20 to 25 (about 25g)', 'Curry leaves - Few', 'Mustard seeds - ½ teaspoon', 'Turmeric powder - ½ teaspoon', 'Salt - As you need', 'Cooking oil - As you need', 'Lime - ½ Large', 'Water - 100ml']
instructions: ['Take the tin fish, open it, drain all the liquid, and take off the fish chunks.', 'Make the dried red chili flakes. Also, get ready with mustard seeds, turmeric powder, salt, and lime.', 'Boil the potatoes and peel off the skin. Also, chop the onions, mince the garlic and chop the curry leaves.', 'Heat the oil in a cooking wok. Add mustard seeds and let it splutter. Then add the onion and curry leaves. Fry them under high flame until the onion has softened and turned translucent for about 3 minutes. Now add minced garlic. Mix and fry them until the onion starts turn to golden color.', 'Now add salt and turmeric powder. Mix and fry them under medium flame for 1 or 2 minutes.', 'Add the tinned fish chunks, dried red chili flakes, and water.', 'Mix everything well and cook covered under low flame for about 5 minutes.', 'Now add the boiled potatoes.', 'Mash the potatoes and tinned fish chunks well enough.', 'Finally, switch off the flame, add lime juice, and give one last good mix.', 'Taste the curry and adjust salt, lime, red chili flakes if needed.', 'Fill the curry between 2 slices of bread.', 'Grease the sandwich toaster with the melted butter.', 'Place the bread inside the sandwich toaster.', 'Close the toaster tightly and toast the bread. Different toasters require different time to toast the bread. For me, it takes about 5 minutes to toast the bread.', 'This is how to make the best spicy tinned fish sandwich toast recipe in Sri Lankan style. Serve and enjoy this bread sandwich toast.']

name: Eggplant Plantain Curry Sri Lankan Style | Kaththarikai Vazhakkai Paal Curry
ingredients: ['Eggplant - 1 large', 'Ash plantain - 1 large', 'Onion - 30g', 'Green chili - 2 or 3', 'Curry leaves - Few', 'Turmeric powder - ½ teaspoon', 'Salt - As you need', 'Thin coconut milk - 200ml', 'Thick coconut milk - 50ml']
instructions: ['Take a large eggplant and a large ash plantain. Cut the eggplant into small pieces. Also, peel off the skin from ash plantain and cut it into small pieces. Rinse both of them well and keep it aside.', 'Chop the onion and slice the green chilies. Also, get ready with curry leaves.', 'Get ready with thick and thin coconut milk.', 'Place the cooking wok on the stove and add eggplant, ash plantain, onions, green chilies, curry leaves, turmeric powder, and salt.', 'Now add thin coconut milk, mix them well, and switch on the flame.', 'Cook covered under medium flame for 10 to 12 minutes.', 'Take off the lid and mash the mixture with the spoon. Do this for 1 or 2 minutes.', 'Finally, add the thick coconut milk, mix them well, and cook covered under medium flame for 2 or 3 minutes.', 'Take off the lid and taste the curry. Adjust salt if needed.', 'Serve and enjoy this delicious eggplant plantain curry in Sri Lankan style.']

name: Simple Red Rice Flour Puttu Recipe (Step by Step Pictures)
ingredients: ['Roasted red rice flour - 600g', 'Hot water - 700ml', 'Salt - As you need', 'Grated coconut - As you wish']
instructions: ['Take the roasted red rice flour.', 'Add salt in the hot water and mix well.', 'Add the salt-mixed-hot-water little by little while mixing the flour.', 'Mix well to small thick pieces.', 'Now put those on a flat surface and using a sharp edge cup or tin make them to a crumble texture.', 'Get ready with the grated coconut.', 'Place the puttu steamer on the stove and boil the water until the steam comes out from the top of the steamer.', 'Now take off the top of the steamer and fill that with the dry crumble mixture and grated coconut. I fill that in the following way. Grated coconut -> dry crumble dough -> grated coconut -> dry crumble dough -> grated coconut -> dry crumble dough -> grated coconut.', 'Steam it till the steam comes out through the top of the steamer. For me, it takes about 4 minutes.', 'Once done, unmold the puttu.', 'This is how to make the simple red rice flour puttu recipe at home. Serve and enjoy this Sri Lankan style red rice flour puttu with curries.']

name: Prawn Fried Noodles Recipe | Best Fried Shrimp Noodles
ingredients: ['Noodle - 400g', 'Prawn/Shrimp - 300g (After clean)', 'Carrot - 150g', 'Leeks - 75g', 'Cabbage - 75g', 'Green bean - 75g', 'Onion - 150g', 'Curry leaves - 3 sprigs', 'Garlic paste - 2 teaspoons', 'Ginger paste - 1 teaspoon', 'Turmeric powder - ½ + ½ teaspoon', 'Salt - As you need', 'Cooking oil - As you need']
instructions: ['Clean the shrimps and rinse them thoroughly. Add turmeric powder and salt. Mix well and let them marinate for 30 minutes.', 'Slice the carrot, cabbage, leeks, green beans, and onions. Also, get read with curry leaves, ginger-garlic paste, turmeric powder, and salt.', 'Boil the noodles and put them in a flat tray. The noodles should be soft and chewy, but not mushy or soggy.', 'Fry the onions till golden brown. For me, it takes about five minutes.', 'Fry the curry leaves. It takes about 30 seconds.', 'Also, fry the marinated prawns till they start turning brown. For me, it takes about five minutes.', 'Now, place a skillet on the stove. Add carrot, cabbage, green beans, turmeric powder, cooking oil, and salt. Give a good mix and switch on the flame.', 'Cook covered under medium flame for about five minutes. In halfway through open the lid and give a good stir to avoid burning.', 'Add leeks and ginger-garlic paste. Mix and cook uncovered under medium flame for two minutes. Stir occasionally to avoid burning.', 'So, now you have the boiled noodles, fried onions, fried curry leaves, fried prawns, and vegetable mix.', 'Using two forks mix them until totally combined. Taste and adjust salt if needed.', 'This is how to make the best prawn fried noodles recipe at home. Serve and enjoy this Sri Lankan style delicious fried shrimp noodles.']

name: Make String Hoppers Homemade Recipe (Red Rice Flour + Plain Flour)
ingredients: ['Roasted red rice flour - 250g', 'Roasted plain flour - 125g', 'Salt - As you need', 'Boiled water - 600ml']
instructions: ['Take a bowl and add the roasted red rice flour and roasted plain flour', 'Boil the water and add salt to it. Add the salted hot water to the flour mix little by little. Mix them up well before the heat goes down.', 'Knead the dough using a spoon until all combined well enough.', 'Now, fill a small portion of dough inside the string hopper press unit.', 'Then, press both handles to squeeze onto the string hopper mats.', 'Now, boil the water in a string hopper steamer and place the string hopper mats inside the steamer.', 'Cook them covered well enough. For me, it takes about 3 minutes to cook.', 'Once done, remove the string hoppers from the string hopper mats.', 'This is how to make string hoppers at home with the combination of red rice flour and plain flour. Serve and enjoy these string hoppers with some good curries.']

name: Make Vegetable Fried Rice without Soy Sauce & Egg
ingredients: ['Basmati rice - 350g', 'Soy meat - 25g (Optional)', 'Carrot - 100g', 'Leeks - 75g', 'Green bean - 75g', 'Onion - 125g', 'Garlic paste - 1 teaspoon', 'Ginger paste - ¼ teaspoon', 'Turmeric powder - ¼ teaspoon', 'Curry leaves - 2 sprigs', 'Salt - As you wish', 'Cooking oil - As you wish']
instructions: ['Wash the rice and boil it. Add little oil and salt when boiling the rice. The boiled rice should soft but not sticky or soggy.', 'Add soy meat and water in a bowl. Let the soy meat to soak for 30 minutes. Then strain all the water and cut them into half. Add salt, mix them well, and keep it aside.', 'Cut the carrot, onion, green bean, and leek. Also, take some curry leaves.', 'Get ready with garlic paste, ginger paste, turmeric powder, and salt.', 'Heat the oil in deep fry wok and add curry leaves. Stir and fry them for 20 to 30 seconds. Once done, put them on top of the boiled rice.', 'Fry the onion under the high flame until it turns into brown color. For me, it takes about 5 minutes. Put them on top of the rice.', 'Fry the soy meat under the high flame until it turns into light brown. For me, it takes about 3 minutes. Once done, put them on top of the rice.', 'Now, heat the oil in a cooking pan and add green bean. Cook uncovered under medium flame for 2 or 3 minutes. Stir occasionally to avoid burn. Then, add the carrot and cook uncovered under medium flame for 3 or 4 minutes. Stir occasionally.', 'Add leeks, salt, and turmeric powder. Stir, mix and cook uncovered under medium flame for 2 or 3 minutes.', 'Finally, add ginger and garlic pastes. Cook uncovered under medium flame for 1 minute. Stir constantly to avoid burn.', 'Now put the vegetable mixture too on top of the boiled rice. So now you have the boiled rice, fried curry leaves, onions, soy meat, and vegetable mixture.', 'Mix them well till totally combined.', 'Taste the rice and adjust salt if needed.', 'This is how to make vegetable fried rice in a quick and easy way. Serve and enjoy this Sri Lankan style healthy vegetable fried rice without soya sauce and eggs.']

name: Whole Wheat Flour String Hoppers Recipe (Atta Flour Idiyappam)
ingredients: ['Roasted whole wheat flour/Atta flour - 300g', 'Hot water - 225ml', 'Normal water - 175ml', 'Salt - As you need']
instructions: ['Take a large bowl and add the roasted whole wheat flour.', 'Mix the hot water, ordinary water, and salt together. (Refer Note 1)', 'Pour the water into the whole wheat flour little by little. Don’t let the water’s hotness gets down.', 'While you pour the semi-hot water little by little, mix them using a spoon.', 'Now, kneading the dough with your fingers to smooth and doesn’t stick.', 'Wash your hands, string hopper press, and string hopper trays.', 'Now, fill the dough in the string hopper press and press both handles to squeeze onto the string hopper trays. (Refer Note 2)', 'Heat the water in a string hopper steamer.', 'Once the water boiled, place the string hopper trays in the steamer. Cook covered under high flame until the string hoppers cooked well. It may take about 2 to 4 minutes. (Refer Note 3)', 'Now, take off the trays and let them cool down.', 'Finally, remove the string hoppers from the trays.', 'Repeat the same process until you done with the dough.', 'Serve and enjoy these Sri Lankan style easy and healthy whole wheat flour string hoppers.']

name: How to Make White Puttu | All-Purpose Flour Puttu Sri Lankan
ingredients: ['Steamed all-purpose flour - 750g', 'Hot water - 625ml', 'Salt - As you need', 'Grated coconut - As you need']
instructions: ['Take the steamed all-purpose flour. Also, add salt in the hot water, give a stir, and keep aside.', 'Add the salt-mixed-hot-water little by little while mixing the flour. Mix well to small thick pieces.', 'Now put those on a flat surface and use a sharp edge cup or tin to make them crumble. Besides, get ready with the grated coconut.', 'Place the puttu steamer on the stove and boil the water until the steam comes out from the top of the steamer.', 'Now take off the top of the steamer and fill that with the dry crumble mixture and grated coconut. I fill that in the following way. Grated coconut -> dry crumble dough -> grated coconut -> dry crumble dough -> grated coconut -> dry crumble dough -> grated coconut.', 'Cook till steam comes out through the top of the steamer. For me, it takes about 2 minutes for each batch.', 'Once done, unmold the puttu.', 'This is how to make the white puttu recipe at home. Serve and enjoy this Sri Lankan style all-purpose flour puttu with curries.']

name: Make Mixed Vegetable Roti Recipe (Easy | Tasty | Vegan)
ingredients: ['All-purpose flour - 1kg', 'Green bean - 40g', 'Carrot - 50g', 'Leeks - 50g', 'Green chili - 50g', 'Onion - 175g', 'Grated coconut - 200g', 'Baking powder - 1 teaspoon', 'Sugar - 1 tablespoon', 'Salt - As you wish', 'Water - 400ml', 'Cooking oil - 4 tablespoons']
instructions: ['Take the green bean, leeks, carrots, green chilies, and onions. Clean and wash them well. Chop them into small pieces.', 'Get ready with grated coconut, salt, sugar, baking powder, and water.', 'Take a large bowl and add all purpose flour. Also, add salt, baking powder, and sugar. Mix them well till totally combined.', 'Now add carrot, green bean, leeks, green chili, onion, and grated coconut.', 'Mix them well and add the water.', 'Mix everything well using your fingers, knuckles, and palm.', 'Knead the dough for 4 or 5 minutes. The dough should smooth and soft. Add water or flour as needed to adjust consistency.', 'Now add the cooking oil.', 'Again knead the dough for 1 or 2 minutes. The dough should smooth and elastic but not sticky.', 'Now make the balls as you want and keep them aside for at least 1 hour before making the roti.', 'Grease a little oil on a floured surface. On the floured surface, use the rolling pin to roll out the balls until very thin.', 'Heat the skillet and place the thin dough layer on it. Flip and cook on the other side. It took one minute for each side under low flame.', 'This is how to make mixed vegetable roti recipe. Serve and enjoy this Sri Lankan style simple vegetarian roti.']

name: Easy Chicken Curry without Coconut Milk or Cream | KETO | Spicy
ingredients: ['Chicken - 1kg', 'Tomato - 250g', 'Onion - 150g', 'Garlic paste - 1 tablespoon', 'Ginger paste - ½ tablespoon', 'Curry powder - 3 tablespoons', 'Cardamom - 4', 'Crushed cinnamon - ½ tablespoon', 'Turmeric powder - 1 teaspoon', 'Mustard seeds - ½ teaspoon', 'Curry leaves - Few', 'Salt - As you want (KETO people use the Himalayan Pink Salt)', 'Cooking oil - As you need (KETO people use the Organic Coconut Oil)', 'Water - 500ml']
instructions: ['Slice the tomatoes and chop the onions. Also, prepare the ginger and garlic paste. Additionally, get ready with curry leaves, water, curry powder, turmeric powder, mustard seeds, cardamom, cinnamon, and salt.', 'Cut the chicken into your desired size pieces and rinse them well. Add turmeric powder, salt, ginger paste, and garlic paste. Mix well and let them marinate for at least 30 minutes.', 'Heat the oil and add mustard seeds. Let them splutter. Then add the onions and curry leaves. Sauté till onions turn to translucent. For me, it takes about 2 minutes. Now, add the crushed cardamom and cinnamon. Stir and fry them till onions turn golden.', 'Add tomatoes and cook them under high flame for about 2 minutes. Stir occasionally to avoid burning.', 'Now add the marinated chicken pieces and give a good mix until all combined.', 'Cook covered under high flame for 5 minutes.', 'Take off the lid and give a good gentle stir. Again cook covered under the high flame until all the liquid evaporates. For me, it takes about 10 minutes.', 'Now take off the lid and cook uncovered under medium flame until the chicken pieces get bit fried. Stir occasionally to avoid burning. For me, it takes about 4 minutes. Then add the curry powder and water. Mix them well.', 'Cook covered under high flame for 3 to 4 minutes.', 'Take off the lid, give a gentle stir, and again cook covered under very low flame for about 5 minutes.', 'Taste the gravy and adjust salt if needed.', 'This is how to make an easy chicken curry without coconut milk or cream. Serve and enjoy this Sri Lankan style simple spicy chicken curry.']

name: Mutton Boti Curry Recipe | Goat Intestine Gravy | Sri Lankan Babath
ingredients: ['Mutton boti – 1kg', 'Onion - 100g', 'Chopped ginger - 1 tablespoon', 'Curry powder - 3 tablespoons', 'Turmeric powder - 1 teaspoon', 'Mustard seeds - ¼ teaspoon', 'Cardamom - 4 or 5', 'Crushed cinnamon - ½ tablespoon', 'Curry leaves - Few', 'Thick coconut milk - 300ml', 'Lime - ½', 'Salt - As you want', 'Cooking oil - As you want']
instructions: ['Take the mutton boti/intestine, clean, and rinse them well 2 or 3 times. Add turmeric powder, salt, cardamom, and cinnamon. Give a good mix.', 'Cook covered under the high flame until mutton boti turns tender and all the liquid evaporates. In halfway through, open the lid and give a good stir. For me, it takes about 30 minutes.', 'Once the cooked boti cools down, cut them into small pieces.', 'Cut the onion and mince the ginger. Also, prepare the thick coconut milk. Besides, get ready with curry leaves, lime, mustard seeds, curry powder, salt, and cooking oil.', 'Heat the oil and add mustard seeds. Let them splutter. Then add onion and curry leaves. Sauté them till the onion starts turn to golden.', 'Now add the cooked mutton boti. Give a good mix and cook uncovered under medium flame for 6 to 8 minutes. Stir occasionally to avoid burning.', 'Now, add curry powder, salt, and coconut milk. Give a good mix.', 'Cook covered under medium flame for 5 minutes.', 'Finally, switch off the flame, add ginger, and squeeze the lime. Give one last good mix. Adjust salt if needed.', 'This is how to make a spicy mutton boti curry recipe. Serve and enjoy this Sri Lankan style babath curry dish.']

name: How To Make Sri Lankan Dosa Recipe | Jaffna Style Dosa Quick & Easy
ingredients: ['Split skinned black gram/Urad dal - 150g', 'Basmati rice - 50g', 'Steamed plain flour - 150g', 'Fenugreek seeds - ½ teaspoon', 'Turmeric powder - ½ teaspoon', 'Baking powder - ¼ teaspoon', 'Water - 350ml', 'Salt - As you need']
instructions: ['Get ready with urad dal, basmati rice, and fenugreek seeds.', 'Take a bowl and add urad dal, basmati rice, and fenugreek seeds. Now add water and leave it to soak for 10 hours. (Refer Note 1)', 'Now wash the mixture at least 2 or 3 times.', 'Grind the mixture to a smooth batter. You need to add water when you grind. I used 350ml of water.', 'Now add salt and toasted plain flour. (Refer Note 2)', 'Mix everything well enough until the toasted plain flour completely dissolve with the batter.', 'Now keep the batter aside until it gets fermented. It usually takes 10 to 12 hours. (Refer Note 3)', 'Finally, add turmeric powder and baking powder. Mix them well and leave it to at least 15 minutes before you are going to make dosa.', 'Now you can make Sri Lankan dosa as you wish.', 'Using a ladle, take the ladle full batter and pour it on a preheated dosa pan. Now gently round and spread the batter evenly using the same ladle.', 'This is how to make Sri Lankan dosa recipe. It is the quick and easy way to make Jaffna style dosa.']

name: How To Make Kothu Roti At Home | Easy Beef Koththu Parotta Recipe
ingredients: ['Parotta/Roti - 15 (Each Roti is about 15cm diameter)', 'Beef Curry - Curry from 500g of beef', 'Eggs - 7', 'Leeks - 75g', 'Carrot - 100g', 'Curry leaves - Few', 'Onion - 250g', 'Green chili - 25g', 'Salt - As you need', 'Cooking oil - As you need']
instructions: ['First, you should have to make a beef curry. (Refer Note 1)', 'Take the Parotta or Roti and cut it into small pieces.', 'Take the eggs and keep them aside.', 'Chop the onions, green chilies, and curry leaves. (Refer Note 2)', 'Take the carrot, peel off the skin, wash it, and cut it into small pieces. Likewise, take the leeks, cut it into small pieces and wash them well at least 2 or 3 times.', 'Heat the oil in an egg fry pan and add the eggs. Add some salt as well. Put the flame on medium. Using a spatula, move the eggs around in the pan to make sure that they cooked thoroughly.', 'Continue cooking and scrambling the eggs until thickened and no visible liquid egg remains. Keep the well-scrambled eggs aside for final preparation.', 'Heat the oil in a large cooking pan and add 80% of onions (Keep the rest of 20% for final preparation). Sauté the onions on medium flame until it gets translucent.', 'Add 80% of green chilies (Keep the rest of 20% for final preparation) and curry leaves. Stir and cook for 2 minutes.', 'Add carrots, mix, stir, and cook for another 2 minutes.', 'Add the leeks and cook for 1 minute.', 'Now add the pieces of parotta.', 'Add the beef curry as well. (Refer Note 3)', 'Turn the flame to high, mix and stir everything well for at least 1 or 2 minutes constantly.', 'At last, add the scrambled egg, rest of the onion, and green chilies. Put the flame on low, cook, and mix everything for 1 or 2 minutes.', 'Taste the kothu roti and add salt if needed.', 'Serve and enjoy this delicious Sri Lankan style beef kothu roti. This is how to make kothu roti at home easily.']

name: Simple Vegetable Fried Noodles Recipe Without Soy Sauce
ingredients: ['Noodles - 400g', 'Cabbage - 100g', 'Carrot - 125g', 'Banana pepper - 50g', 'Leeks - 100g', 'Onion - 150g', 'Soya meat - 30g (Optional)', 'Curry leaves - 2 sprigs', 'Ginger paste - ½ teaspoon', 'Garlic paste - 1 teaspoon', 'Turmeric powder - ¼ teaspoon', 'Salt - As you want', 'Cooking oil - As you need']
instructions: ['Add soya meat and water in a bowl and let the soy meat to soak for 30 minutes.', 'After 30 minutes wash the soy meat 2 or 3 times and cut them in the half. Add some salt, mix and keep it aside.', 'Take carrot, leeks, cabbage, and banana pepper, clean and wash them.', 'Chop the vegetables into small pieces.', 'Slice the onions and get ready with curry leaves.', 'Get ready with ginger paste, garlic paste, turmeric powder, and salt. (Refer Note 1)', 'Boil the noodles and spread it on a flat tray or on a large bowl. (Refer Note 2 & Note 3)', 'Heat the oil in deep fry cooking pot and add curry leaves. Fry them under the high flame for 20 to 30 seconds. Once it has done, add them on top of the noodles.', 'Now fry the onions. Fry them under high flame until it turns into brown color. You should stir occasionally. For me, it takes about 5 minutes. Once it has done, add them on top of the noodles. (Refer Note 4)', 'Then fry the salted soy meat. Fry them under high flame until it turns into little brown color. For me, it takes about 3 minutes. Once it fried, add them on top of the noodles.', 'Now heat the oil in a cooking pan and add cabbage. Stir and cook covered under medium flame for 1 or 2 minutes.', 'Add the carrot and mix them well. Cook covered under medium flame for 1 or 2 minutes.', 'Now add long banana, leeks, turmeric powder, and salt. Mix and cook uncovered under medium flame for 2 or 3 minutes. You should stir occasionally to avoid burn.', 'At last, add the ginger and garlic pastes. Stir, mix and cook uncovered under low flame for 1 minute. You should stir constantly.', 'Add the vegetable mixture on top of the noodles. Now you have boiled noodles, all fried things, and vegetable mixture.', 'Mix everything well until totally combined. I used two forks to mix them up. Though you can do by your own way.', 'Taste the noodles and adjust salt if needed.', 'This is how to make simple vegetarian noodle recipe. Serve and enjoy this delicious and healthy vegetable noodles in Sri Lankan style.']

name: Best Chicken Fried Rice Recipe without Egg, Peas, & Soy Sauce
ingredients: ['Basmati rice - 400g', 'Boneless chicken - 400g', 'Carrot - 100g', 'Green bean - 75g', 'Leeks - 75g', 'Onion - 100g', 'Curry leaves - 1 or 2 sprigs', 'Garlic paste - 1 teaspoon', 'Ginger paste - ¼ teaspoon', 'Turmeric powder - ¾ teaspoon', 'Cinnamon - 4 to 6', 'Crushed cardamom - ½ teaspoon', 'Salt - As you need', 'Cooking oil - As you need']
instructions: ['Take the basmati rice and wash it. Add little oil and salt when you cook the rice. The cooked rice should be soft but not mushy or sticky.', 'Once the rice cooked, put it on a flat surface container and spread it well. (Refer Note 1)', 'Take the boneless chicken, cut it into large pieces, and rinse them well. Also, get ready with cinnamon, cardamom, ½ teaspoon of turmeric powder, and salt.', 'Place the cooking pot on the stove and place the chicken pieces, cardamom, cinnamon, turmeric powder, and slat. Mix them until totally combined and switch on the flame.', 'Cook covered under high flame until the chicken cooked enough. In a halfway through, open the lid and give a good stir. For me, it takes about 12 minutes. (Refer Note 2)', 'When the heat goes down, tear the chicken into small pieces.', 'Take carrot, green bean, and leeks. Clean and wash them well. Also, slice the carrot, chop the green bean, and chop the leeks.', 'Slice the onions and take one or two sprigs of curry leaves. Also, get ready with, garlic paste, ginger paste, ¼ teaspoon of turmeric powder, and salt. (Refer Note 3)', 'Heat the oil and fry the curry leaves under the high flame for 30 seconds. Put it on top of the rice.', 'Fry the onions under high flame until it turns to golden color. For me, it takes about 5 minutes. Once it has done, put it on top of the rice.', 'Fry the chicken pieces under medium flame until it starts to turn to golden color. For me, it takes around 5 minutes. Once done, put it on top of the rice. (Refer Note 4)', 'Now, heat some cooking oil in a pot and add green bean. Cook covered under low flame for 2 or 3 minutes.', 'Add the carrot and mix them.', 'Cook covered under low flame for another 2 or 3 minutes.', 'Now, add the leeks, mix, and cook uncovered under medium flame for 2 or 3 minutes. You should stir occasionally to avoid burn.', 'Finally, add garlic paste, ginger paste, ¼ teaspoon of turmeric powder, and salt. Stir, mix and cook uncovered under low flame for 1 minute. Stir constantly to avoid burn.', 'Once you have done with the vegetable mixture, put that on top of the rice. So, now you have the boiled rice, fried curry leaves, fried onions, fried shredded chicken pieces, and the vegetable mixture.', 'Mix until everything combined well.', 'This is how to make the best chicken fried rice recipe without eggs, peas, and soy sauce. Serve and enjoy this delicious simple chicken fried rice in Sri Lankan style.']

name: Easy Dal Curry for Bread Recipe | Dhal/Parippu Coconut Milk Vegan
ingredients: ['Dal/Dhal/Parippu - 150g', 'Onion - 100g', 'Thin milk - 350ml', 'Water 400ml', 'Garlic paste - ½ tablespoon', 'Dried red chili - 2 or 3', 'Curry leaves - Few', 'Mustard seeds - ¼ teaspoon', 'Cumin seeds - 2 pinches', 'Fennel seeds - ½ teaspoon', 'Turmeric powder - ½ teaspoon', 'Salt - As you wish', 'Cooking oil - As you need']
instructions: ['Take the dal and wash it for 2 or 3 times.', 'Chop the onion and dried red chili. Also, get ready with curry leaves, salt, turmeric powder, mustard seeds, fennel seeds, cumin seeds, and garlic paste.', 'Extract the coconut milk from grated coconut and take some water. (Refer Note 1)', 'Place the cooking pan on the stove and add the dal. Also, add the water.', 'Mix and switch on the flame. Cook uncovered under the high flame for 7 to 9 minutes. During this time the water may foam up, so keep your eye on it. (Refer Note 2)', 'Now add salt and turmeric powder. Mix well and cook uncovered under high flame until the dal gets boiled enough and turns tender. For me, it takes about 3 minutes.', 'Add thin coconut milk and mix well.', 'Cook uncovered under the high flame for 2 to 4 minutes. Now switch off the flame and leave it aside for final preparation.', 'On the other side, heat the oil in a cooking pan. Add mustard seeds and let it splutter.', 'Now add onion, curry leaves, and dried red chili. Stir and fry everything until the onion just starts to turn a golden color.', 'Add fennel seeds, cumin seeds, and garlic paste. Stir and fry them for 30 seconds.', 'Finally, add the prepared dal curry to this fried mix.', 'Mix everything and taste the curry. Adjust salt if needed and switch off the flame. (Refer Note 3)', 'This is how to make dal curry for bread. Serve and enjoy this Sri Lankan style delicious dhal curry with bread.']

name: Easy Idli Dosa Batter (How To Make Idli & Dosa With Same Batter Homemade)
ingredients: ['Split skinned black gram/Urad dal - 250g', 'Idli rice/Parboiled rice - 750g', 'Salt - As you need', 'Water - As you need']
instructions: ['Take the urad dal or split skinned black gram in a bowl. Add water and leave it to soak for 4 to 5 hours. In another bowl, soak the idli rice in water for the same time. (Refer Note 1)', 'Now, wash both urad dal and idli rice separately at least 2 or 3 times. Drain off the water completely.', 'Put the urad dal into the food processor or blender. Add some water. The water level should be exactly same level of urad dal.', 'Grind it until you get a smooth batter. Pour the batter into the bowl and keep aside.', 'Likewise, put the idli rice in the blender and add some water. Again the water level should be exactly same level of idli rice. Grind it until you get a smooth batter. Pour the smooth batter on top of the urad dal batter.', 'Add some salt. I added about 2 teaspoons. (Refer Note 2)', 'Mix both well with the spoon. Keep in mind, it is good to mix the batter in one direction. It could be either clockwise or anti-clockwise direction. Now, keep the mixture aside until it gets fermented. It usually takes 10 to 14 hours. (Refer Note 3 and Note 4)', 'After fermentation is complete, gently stir the batter with the spoon in one direction. Take the batter you want to use in a bowl and keep the balance in the fridge for future use. (Refer Note 5)', 'Alright, now it’s time to make idli or dosa.', 'For idli, take the idli steamer and get off the idly tray. Pour some water into the idly steamer and place it on the stove. Switch on the flame and boil the water.', 'Grease the idli holders with cooking oil.', 'Pour the batter into the idli holder with the ladle.', 'Fill up all the idli holders.', 'Once the water boils, put the idly tray inside the idli steamer.', 'Cook covered under high flame until the idli is well-cooked. It may take about 10 minutes. (Refer Note 6)', 'Now, take off the idli tray and spray some water on top of each idli. Let it cool down for 1 or 2 minutes.', 'Put a small spoon underneath the idli and carefully spread and take it out. Give a good attention when you take off each idli. I recommend you to use non-stick idly trays so that it will be easy to take it out. (Refer Note 7)', 'You can have these idlies with sambal or with sambar or any other dish which suits for idli.', 'For dosa, heat the non-stick dosa pan and pour the batter using a ladle. (Refer Note 8)', 'Using the same ladle gently round the batter and spread it evenly.', 'If you want, you can add some ghee or oil on top of the dosa. When it is cooked enough flip it to the other side.', 'To make egg dosa, pour one egg on top of the dosa. Add some ghee or oil around the egg edges. You don’t need to flip it to the other side. But if you don’t like half boiled egg, you should flip it to the other side as well.', 'This is how to make soft idli and crispy dosa with the same easy idli dosa batter.']

name: Sri Lankan Beef Biryani Recipe with Potatoes | Easy Homemade
ingredients: ['Beef - 500g', 'Potatoes - 250g', 'Basmati rice - 350g', 'Onion - 100g', 'Green chili - 6 to 8', 'Garlic clove - 4 to 6', 'Ginger root - Small (About the size of 1 garlic clove)', 'Thick coconut milk - 300ml', 'Curry leaves - Few', 'Fennel seeds - 1 tablespoon', 'Cumin seeds - ½ teaspoon', 'Black pepper - 1 tablespoon', 'Coriander seeds - 1 teaspoon', 'Turmeric powder - ½ teaspoon', 'Cardamom - 6 to 8', 'Crushed cinnamon - ½ tablespoon', 'Salt - As you need', 'Cooking oil - As you need']
instructions: ['Take the beef and cut into medium-sized pieces. Rinse them well and keep aside.', 'Take the grinder and add black pepper, fennel seeds, cumin seeds, coriander seeds, garlic cloves, ginger, and a little water. Also, get ready with turmeric powder and salt.', 'Grind them to smooth paste.', 'Now add turmeric powder, salt, and ground mixture to the beef.', 'Mix well and let them marinate for at least an hour.', 'Chop the onion, cut the green chilies by half, and crush the cinnamon. Also, get ready with curry leaves and cardamom. Besides, extract the thick coconut milk from grated coconut.', 'Slice the potatoes into medium size. Also, get ready with basmati rice.', 'Heat the oil, add cardamom and cinnamon. Sauté them for 10 to 20 seconds. I suggest you use a large non-stick cooking pot with a lid.', 'Now add the onions, curry leaves, and green chilies. Fry them under high flame until the onion starts to turn a golden color. Stir occasionally to avoid burn. For me, it takes about 3 minutes.', 'Add the marinated beef and mix them well. Cook covered under the high flame for 6 to 8 minutes.', 'Take off the lid and add potatoes. Now add the coconut milk and mix them well. Also, taste the curry and adjust salt if needed.', 'Cook covered under medium flame until you get a well-cooked beef with little gravy. For me, it takes about 15 minutes.', 'While you cook the beef, wash the basmati rice and boil it. It is enough to boil the rice for 90%.', 'Once the rice 90% done, strain the water and add all the rice on top of the beef curry. Spread it evenly.', 'Finally, cook covered under very low flame for 6 to 8 minutes.', 'Switch off the flame and mix everything well until all combined.', 'This is how to make Sri Lankan beef biryani recipe with potatoes. Serve and enjoy this delicious Sri Lankan style beef biryani.']

name: Vegetable Kurakkan Noodles Recipe (Finger Millet)
ingredients: ['Kurakkan noodles - 1 packet (400g)', 'Carrot - 200g', 'Green beans - 50g', 'Cabbage - 70g', 'Onion - 200g', 'Curry leaves - 2 or 3 sprigs', 'Cooking oil - As you need', 'Salt - As you need', 'Crushed garlic - ½ tablespoon', 'Crushed ginger - ¼ tablespoon', 'Mustard seeds - ½ teaspoon', 'Maggi vegetable stock cube - 1 tablespoon', 'Dry roast grated coconut - 4 or 5 tablespoons']
instructions: ['Boil the Kurakkan noodles. The noodles should soft and chewy but not soggy and mushy.', 'Dry roast the grated coconut.', 'Finely slice the onions and take few curry leaves.', 'Heat the oil in a deep fry pan. Fry the sliced onions until it turns to caramelized.', 'Fry the curry leaves for 30 to 45 seconds.', 'Finely slice the carrots and cabbage. Also, finely chop the green beans.', 'Crush the garlic and ginger, and Maggi vegetable stock cube. Also, get ready with mustard seeds.', 'Now heat the oil and add mustard seeds. Let the mustard seeds splutter.', 'Add green beans and cook covered for 2 minutes under medium flame.', 'Take off the lid, stir well and add the carrot. Also, add salt as you need. Cook uncovered for another 2 minutes under medium flame.', 'Add crushed garlic and ginger. Mix it well and cook uncovered for 2 minutes under low flame. Stir occasionally to avoid burning.', 'Now, add cabbage and cook for 1 to 2 minutes under medium flame. Stir frequently to avoid burning.', 'Finally, add the boiled noodles and mix it well under very low flame until all combined.', 'At last, switch off the flame and add deep-fried onions, curry leaves, dry roast grated coconut, and crushed vegetable stock cube. Mix everything until all combined well.', 'Taste the noodles and add salt if you need.', 'This is how to make vegetable kurakkan noodles recipe at home. Serve and enjoy this Sri Lankan style vegan fried noodles.']

name: Sri Lankan Style Squid Curry | Spicy Cuttlefish Recipe
ingredients: ['Squid/cuttlefish - 400g', 'Onion - 40g', 'Garlic cloves - 4 or 5', 'Crushed ginger - ½ teaspoon', 'Curry leaves - Few', 'Curry powder - 2 tablespoons', 'Fenugreek seeds - ½ teaspoon', 'Mustard seeds - ¼ teaspoon', 'Fennel seeds - ¼ teaspoon', 'Turmeric powder - ¼ teaspoon', 'Salt - As you need', 'Thick coconut milk - 250ml', 'Thick tamarind juice - 50ml', 'Cooking oil - As you need']
instructions: ['Clean the squids and cut them into ring style pieces as shown in the picture below. Rinse them well enough.', 'Sliced the onions, chopped the garlic cloves, and crushed the ginger as shown in the picture below. Also, get ready with curry leaves.', 'Take the fenugreek seeds, mustard seeds, fennel seeds, turmeric powder, and salt.', 'Prepare 250ml of thick coconut milk.', 'Also, prepare 50ml of thick tamarind juice.', 'Add turmeric powder and salt to the pieces of squids. Mix and let them marinate for at least 30 minutes.', 'Heat the oil and add mustard seeds. Let the mustard seeds splutter.', 'Add sliced onions and sauté them until they turn to light brown color.', 'Now add garlic, ginger, curry leaves, fenugreek seeds, and fennel seeds. Stir frequently and fry them for one minute under medium flame.', 'Add the pieces of squids and mix them well.', 'Cook covered under high flame for 5 to 7 minutes.', 'Take off the lid and stir frequently until the squids get a little fry. Now, add thick coconut milk and tamarind juice.', 'Soon after, add curry powder and mix everything well.', 'Now cook covered under very low flame for 10 to 12 minutes.', 'Taste the curry and adjust salt if needed.', 'This is how to make the best Sri Lankan style squid curry recipe. Serve and enjoy this spicy cuttlefish curry.']

name: Whole Wheat Flour String Hoppers Recipe (Atta Flour Idiyappam)
ingredients: ['Roasted whole wheat flour/Atta flour - 300g', 'Hot water - 225ml', 'Normal water - 175ml', 'Salt - As you need']
instructions: ['Take a large bowl and add the roasted whole wheat flour.', 'Mix the hot water, ordinary water, and salt together. (Refer Note 1)', 'Pour the water into the whole wheat flour little by little. Don’t let the water’s hotness gets down.', 'While you pour the semi-hot water little by little, mix them using a spoon.', 'Now, kneading the dough with your fingers to smooth and doesn’t stick.', 'Wash your hands, string hopper press, and string hopper trays.', 'Now, fill the dough in the string hopper press and press both handles to squeeze onto the string hopper trays. (Refer Note 2)', 'Heat the water in a string hopper steamer.', 'Once the water boiled, place the string hopper trays in the steamer. Cook covered under high flame until the string hoppers cooked well. It may take about 2 to 4 minutes. (Refer Note 3)', 'Now, take off the trays and let them cool down.', 'Finally, remove the string hoppers from the trays.', 'Repeat the same process until you done with the dough.', 'Serve and enjoy these Sri Lankan style easy and healthy whole wheat flour string hoppers.']

name: Make Tomato Sodhi Recipe | Easy & Quick Vegan Sothi | KETO
ingredients: ['Tomato - 150g', 'Turmeric powder - ½ teaspoon', 'Fenugreek seeds - ¼ teaspoon', 'Onion - 30g', 'Curry leaves - Few', 'Green chili - 3 or 4', 'Lime - ½', 'Thin coconut milk - 350ml', 'Thick coconut milk - 200ml', 'Salt - As you wish']
instructions: ['Cut the tomato into medium size pieces. Also, slice the green chilies and chop the onions. Besides, get ready with lime, curry leaves, fenugreek seeds, turmeric powder, and salt.', 'Prepare the thin and thick coconut milk.', 'In a cooking pot add tomato, turmeric powder, fenugreek seeds, salt, onion, curry leaves, green chilies, and thin coconut milk. Give a mix and switch on the flame.', 'Cook covered under high flame for about five to six minutes. If the milk foams up reduce the flame and give a good stir.', 'Now add the thick coconut milk and cook uncovered under medium flame for about two minutes. Stir occasionally to avoid foaming.', 'Finally, switch off the flame and add the lime juice. Also, taste and adjust salt if needed.', 'This is the easy and best way to make Tomato Sodhi recipe. Serve and enjoy this Sri Lankan style vegan sothi.']

name: How to Make Vegetable Rava Upma | Easy & Healthy Breakfast
ingredients: ['Toasted Semolina/Sooji/Rava - 250g', 'Carrot - 75g', 'Green bean - 30g', 'Leeks - 50g', 'Onion - 50g', 'Curry leaves - Few', 'Butter - 1 tablespoon', 'Thin coconut milk - 400ml', 'Dried red chili - 2 or 3', 'Mustard seeds - ¼ teaspoon', 'Turmeric powder - ¼ teaspoon', 'Salt - As you wish', 'Cooking oil - As you need']
instructions: ['Take the carrot, green bean, and leeks. Clean and wash them well. (Refer Note 1)', 'Chop the carrot, green bean, leeks, and onion.', 'Chop the dried red chili and curry leaves. In addition, get ready with salt, turmeric powder, mustard seeds, and toasted semolina. (Refer Note 2)', 'Extract the thin coconut milk and take the butter. (Refer Note 3)', 'First of all, heat the oil and add mustard seeds. Let it splutter. Now add curry leaves, and dried red chilies. Fry them for 30 seconds.', 'Add the onions, green bean, and carrot. Stir and cook uncovered under medium flame for about 3 minutes.', 'Add chopped leeks. Stir and cook on medium flame for about 30 seconds.', 'Now add butter, salt, turmeric powder, and thin coconut milk.', 'Mix everything well and cook uncovered under high flame until the milk foams up. For me, the milk has foamed up in a minute.', 'Now turn the flame to low and add the toasted semolina. As soon as you add the semolina, stir and mix as quickly as you can. Constantly stir and mix everything under low flame for about 2 minutes.', 'Finally, switch off the flame, stir, and mix repeatedly for a minute. (Refer Note 4)', 'Taste and adjust salt if needed.', 'This is how to make vegetable Rava Upma at home. Serve and enjoy this Sri Lankan style mixed vegetable Rava Upma.']

name: How To Make Jaffna Odiyal Kool At Home (Spicy Seafood Soup)
ingredients: ['Fish - 1.5kg', 'Cuttlefish/Squid - 250g', 'Prawn/Shrimp - 250g', 'Crab - 500g', 'Long beans - 100g', 'Tapioca - 350g', 'Jackfruit seeds - 200g', 'Palmyra tuber flour/Odiyal flour - 75g', 'Brown rice - 100g', 'Red chili flakes - 75g', 'Turmeric powder - 1 teaspoon', 'Salt - As you need', 'Thin tamarind juice - 600ml', 'Water - 2000ml']
instructions: ['Take the brown rice and wash it thoroughly.', 'Boil the brown rice and keep it aside for final preparation.', 'Clean, rinse, and cut the fish, cuttlefish/squid, prawns/shrimps, and crabs. (Refer Note 1)', 'Rinse and cut the jackfruit seeds, long beans, and tapioca.', 'Get ready with thin tamarind juice and water. (Refer Note 2)', 'Get ready with Odiyal flour, dried red chilies, salt, and turmeric powder.', 'Wash the odiyal flour 2 or 3 times thoroughly before mix it to the Jaffna odiyal kool.', 'Grind the dried red chilies to flakes. (Refer Note 3)', 'Once you have done with all the preparations, place a large cooking pot over the stove.', 'Add the pieces of fish, squid/cuttlefish, prawns/shrimps, and crabs.', 'Now add turmeric powder and salt.', 'Add all the water and mix everything well.', 'Now switch on the flame. Cook covered under the high flame for 15 minutes.', 'Take off the lid and mix everything well. Add the slices of tapioca and jackfruit seeds. Mix and cook covered again under the high flame for 15 minutes.', 'Take off the lid and mash everything a little using a spoon especially the fish pieces. Cook uncovered under the high flame for 5 minutes.', 'Now add long beans pieces and cook uncovered under the high flame for 2 minutes.', 'Add the red chili flakes. (Refer Note 4)', 'Add the thin tamarind juice.', 'Add washed odiyal flour. Once you add odiyal flour, you should mix everything as soon as possible. If not the odiyal flour won’t mix up easily.', 'Finally, add the boiled brown rice.', 'Mix everything well and cook uncovered under medium flame for 5 minutes.', 'Taste it and adjust salt, red chili flakes, tamarind juice if needed.', 'Serve and enjoy this delicious spicy Jaffna odiyal kool or seafood soup in Sri Lankan style.']

name: How to Make Soft Chapati Roti without Oil or Butter (Quick & Easy)
ingredients: ['Whole wheat flour - 500g', 'Salt - As you wish', 'Water - 350ml']
instructions: ['Take the bowl and add whole wheat flour.', 'Add the salt mixed water (Refer Note 1 and Note 2)', 'Knead the dough using your palm and fingers.', 'Knead the dough until everything gets in together. The dough should be soft and elastic but not sticky. (Refer Note 3)', 'Now make the small balls. Keep it aside for at least 30 minutes before making the chapati.', 'On a floured surface, use the floured rolling pin to roll out the balls until very thin.', 'Heat the skillet and put the thin dough layer on it. Cook until the small bubbles start to foam. Once you see the small bubbles, flip and cook on the other side. (Refer Note 4)', 'Repeat the same to every dough balls you intend to make.', 'This is how to make soft chapati roti without a single drop of oil or butter. Serve and enjoy this Sri Lankan style soft chapati.']
